sentence.text: mRNA splicing, via spliceosome regulates various muscle-related functions, but studies have proposed its role in development and angiogenesis also, where it is involved with tumor-associated molecules.
Therefore, we decided to look into its role in tumor progression, tumor angiogenesis, and its negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II on cellular properties.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Further, immunohistochemistry was done to identify mRNA splicing, via spliceosome expression levels in various cancers and its association with tumor angiogenesis.
Immunohistochemistry analysis showed reduced mRNA splicing, via spliceosome levels in tumors which were supported by in silico analysis data.

These findings suggest that reduction in mRNA splicing, via spliceosome expression in gastric, colon and oral cavity tumor might have a role in tumor progression, by regulating cell migration and invasiveness.
